storyInfo: In order to pay her respects to her friend, Saileach makes her way back to the ruins of County Hillock. But to her surprise, there are still people living there.

attributes.content: You know... before I came to Rhodes Island, I'd already anticipated a lot of what I'd encounter. But it only dawned on me, once it all actually came, how none of my preparation was any use.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Being military—even if I was just the most minor guard of honor—I'd always believed firmly in the tenacity of life, that it shouldn't slip away so easily.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: But in this past year, traveling all over Terra's parts with this ship, I've witnessed far too many people...
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Too many people who part like an unnoticed gust of wind, gone gently far before you even notice they came by.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Unable to leave something behind.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: I try and make a record of their faces, their lives that passed on before me, but in just one short year, they've managed to vanish from my memory too.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: You've been through all that yourself, right?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: But you won't give me the answers, will you?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Look at me, still acting like I used to, going through everything on my mind and dumping it on you.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: I brought some flowers today, but they're a little wilted. There weren't any convoys willing to come to these parts, so I just had to walk, and it's hard to keep a bouquet fresh all the way.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: (Is someone there...?)
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Sorry, Lass. Please wait a moment, if you can.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: It's you. Jane Willow.
How come you're...?
How do you know my name?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: D-Don't kill me!
I'm Acton! Acton Corsaire! 5th Defence, 6th Camp of the County Hillock Barracks. D-Do you remember me? We met, just a few years ago!

attributes.name: Saileach
attributes.content: Acton...

attributes.name: Saileach
attributes.content: Yes. I remember, I've met you before. What are you doing here? Haven't the troops here long withdrawn from their stations?
(He pulls on his sleeve.)
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Your arm... You weren't able to evacuate from District Seventeen?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Not one of us had any order to retreat from above when the dirty bombs came. Maybe our kit was broken, or the commanders forgot, or maybe...
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Heh—the farmers know it best, don't they? It's hard not to mess up a few wheat buds when you pull weeds.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I'm so sorry, Acton.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: No, it's fine. I'm more wondering, Jane, what are you doing here?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I... I'm back here to grieve over someone lost.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: What about you? Do you just live in these ruins?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: No, our camp's in the rough outside the plate, I was just in the ruins looking for food. I never thought I'd run into you.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: So you mean, there's other people living here, aside from you?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Yeah. On top of the soldiers who got left behind, there's a few Taran survivors drifting around here.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: After the events, the Army wanted to round up the surviving Infected and keep them under control in one place, so they organized a few searches, but we were lucky enough to avoid those.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Then later down the line, the ruin and pollution here got too severe for their tastes, so they decided to completely abandon this plate, and leave anyone on it to fend for themselves.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Then... did you find anything earlier?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: (Shakes head.) Hah. Going hungry for another few days, looks like.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I've got some rations and medication on me. If you want it, you can have them all.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Thank you, Janie.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Do you have a transmitter here? If I can get in touch with my colleagues, they might be willing to send some supplies in for us.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Er, I've seen one in the ruins.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Where?!
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Not far, but it's where the Tarans are active... If the two of us run into them, it'll get very tricky.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Both sides might be on the same raft, but everyone has it tough. We don't want to feed any more conflict.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: So usually, as long as we can... we try and keep away from each other as much as possible.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Acton, show me the way at least. I need to try, no matter what.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: The active Originium's already concentrated above safe limits ahead... Is this really what the Tarans are living in?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: I've been walking for so long... without a person in sight.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Wait, is that someone?!
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Ma'am! Hold on, please!
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: I don't mean any harm!
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: I have some emergency pharmaceuticals and rations here! In exchange, would you let me use the transmitter?!
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Are...
attributes.name: Feeble Woman

attributes.content: Are you telling... the truth? You have medicine?
attributes.name: Feeble Woman

attributes.content: I do. Here, look, you can take it all if you need.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Come with me.
attributes.name: Feeble Woman

attributes.content: Aislinn, I'm here, I brought somebody.
attributes.name: Feeble Woman

attributes.content: Hurts... help me.
attributes.name: Dying Girl

attributes.content: This is my girl. Can your medicine save her?
attributes.name: Feeble Woman

attributes.content: I... Her condition's too severe. It'd be tricky for emergency drugs to take effect.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Try, please. She's not even seven...
attributes.name: Feeble Woman

attributes.content: I'll... do everything I can.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Aislinn, can you hear what I'm saying?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: (She administers an injection into the girl's body.)
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: It'll be okay, don't fret.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: How is she?!
attributes.name: Feeble Woman

attributes.content: I'm sorry, it's just... not any use.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: It's dark... Mam, I'm... scared.
attributes.name: Dying Girl

attributes.content: Aislinn, Aislinn, don't be afraid, Mam's right here with you.
attributes.name: Feeble Woman

attributes.content: I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: I just... don't have anything I can do. I'm so sorry, ma'am.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: It's cold...
attributes.name: Dying Girl

attributes.content: (Hugs the girl tight.)
attributes.name: Feeble Woman

attributes.content: Ma'am...
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Just go. Don't come back here.
attributes.name: Feeble Woman

attributes.content: I'll leave this food.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: I'm staying in the rough outside the plate for the next few days. If any of you need help, you can come ask me.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Sorry to bother you. I'll be gone in a moment.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: The stuff you want to use is in the building opposite. You can move it on your own.
attributes.name: Feeble Woman

attributes.content: ...Thank you.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Hey, steady there!
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Huff—it didn't occur to me how far your camp would be from the plate.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: I'm surprised you brought back something so massive all by yourself!
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Okay, okay, no time to wallow now, Acton. Let's see if it still works at all first.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Here's the screwdriver.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Oh, we're in luck. It's all intact inside. Just a little adjustment, and it'll be in service.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: You know your way around these things too? I'm blown away... When did you learn this?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: All I can say is, I've picked up a heck of a lot from my new job. Alright, here's your screwdriver back, thanks.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: I'll go hook up the generator.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: How is it? Lights on?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Yep, it's on without a hitch.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: How did you find this device? Did the Taran group give you trouble?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: No, I traded with them for the supplies I had on me.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: That's good, then. At least they know a deal's a deal.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Acton...
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: We need to hold on for a very long while before the supplies arrive.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: During this period, I'd like to start up a few fields, plant some crops and ensure food self-sufficiency. It beats searching the plate by a mile, with how inefficient that is, not to mention the danger.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: That's all well and good, but... a lot of the camp are stuck in dire days. We have barely any proper manpower.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: There's the displaced Tarans aboard the plate too. I'd like them to join in... If we can provide food and clean water, I don't think they'd refuse.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: That's not happening. The first thing that bunch did was drive the lot of us out!
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Acton, I know the rift is intense between your two sides, and making peace seems unimaginable, but this is a dire situation. None of you have any other choice.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: I can only offer you temporary aid. After that, carrying on all comes down to you, and the only ones left who can join hands with you and push on are them. Fellow Infected of yours.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: So, either you shelve your grudge for the time being, and together you survive, or you hold onto your hate, and together you die here.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Let me think... I need to ask the others.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Acton, I met a woman while I was looking for the transmitter... I wasn't able to save her daughter's life, but she still pointed me the right way.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: The woman with the child? I know her. No wonder... She's the only one I've seen in the past few days.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: *sigh* I can't imagine what she does now... her husband, father and sister, they all left her in that atrocity, and now... even her daughter's gone.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: So give it a think, Acton. They're just a group of people that want to survive, same as you.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Hey, Chuck, d'you trust these people? I just feel like they'd have to have something in store for us down the line.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Don't know, nor do I want to. Haven't had a meal for days. Brain just says, eat something to keep the needle off empty.
attributes.name: Apathetic Taran Man

attributes.content: It's some swindle, absolutely. I tell you, these army boys, they've got hell in mind for us.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: So what? You keep talking, but here you are anyway.
attributes.name: Apathetic Taran Man

attributes.content: Hmph... that Vouivre's holding onto Oripathy suppressants there. My bad parts have been feeling like murder in recent days.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: There's simple water purifiers on the camp's east. To the south is the farmland we're about to clear. The sick have all agreed to be housed for nursing in the tent on the north end.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: At noontime and evening each day, you can get a portion of food from the center of the camp.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Ahem... that's all. Janie, anything you'd like to add?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Can I just ask everyone, have you seen a woman around? She's very slim, and she's carrying a girl... but the child passed away not long ago.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Máire? You mean Máire?
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Brown hair, small mole under her eyes?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Right, that's her. What do you want with her? What, has she offended you?
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: No, I just wanted to ask, is she doing okay?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Mystery, isn't it? Haven't seen her who knows how long. Could be dead herself in someplace.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: But you... I thought you would've at least been aware of each other.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Here?!
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Vouivre, no one's got the time to care for anyone else here.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: What are you looking at me like that for? I'm just... telling the truth.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: It's fine. Thank you all for coming out so far. Get some rest as soon as you can. We have a lot of things waiting for us tomorrow.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Janie, I don't understand. Where's the point in what you're doing? We've given them food to eat, and a place to stay.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I'm not crossing my fingers they'll be happy with us any day, but at the very least, we could just about live without bothering each other!
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Take yesterday, I heard a brawl sprung up while work was happening, and someone's still lying on the couch today with stars around their head.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Ungh... this fruit's too high. I can't reach.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Janie, Janie! Are you listening to me?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Hm? Oh, that, I know. It was one of yours who decided to be rude first, Acton.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Says who?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I rushed over the moment the conflict sparked off, and it was me who helped the one with a knock on the head back to camp too.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: The... Did you even sort out what happened, Janie?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I did. So, as a token of apology, I think you can present them this basket of fruit, in person.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: This is killing me... Miss Saileach, am I going to die?
attributes.name: Pained Sickly Soldier

attributes.content: You'll be fine, I've already jabbed you with painkillers. Just hold on a little, and it'll kick in soon.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Thank you... *cough* *cough*
attributes.name: Pained Sickly Soldier

attributes.content: How are you now? Any better?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: If you could just, keep talking to me... I'm scared.
attributes.name: Pained Sickly Soldier

attributes.content: What do you want to hear?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Anything, I just want... to have a voice by my side.
attributes.name: Pained Sickly Soldier

attributes.content: Alright. Will a song be okay?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Yeah...
attributes.name: Pained Sickly Soldier

attributes.content: 'If only we were a pair of white feathers, roaming free on the breaks of the waves,'
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: 'Time would farewell us to be forgotten, and never would either we sorrow again...'
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Miss Saileach...
attributes.name: Apathetic Taran Man

attributes.content: Shh, he's asleep.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: (Thank you, Mr. Chuck, for being so willing to help me look after these people.)
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: (No problem. Want some wild fruit? I'll fetch you one.)
attributes.name: Apathetic Taran Man

attributes.content: (Wild fruit? Did you pick it?)
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: (No, it's from an army boy. They taste alright. Don't know why they felt so kind all of a sudden.)
attributes.name: Apathetic Taran Man

attributes.content: (I'm guessing, they wanted to apologize for what happened a few days ago.)
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: (That's a tall tale...)
attributes.name: Apathetic Taran Man

attributes.content: Rgh... cold.
attributes.name: Pained Sickly Soldier

attributes.content: Though his face twists as he does it, the man tucks the patient gently back into his bed.
(Tch. Boy can't even sleep tight.)
attributes.name: Apathetic Taran Man

attributes.content: Acton, quickly, wake up!
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: What is it, Janie?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: There's a serious leak in the north side patients' tent! Fetch a few people to come with me, quickly!
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: What?! Hold on, I'll be right there.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Quickly, Acton!
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: I'm here. How are the sick inside? What's your plan? Dammit, the rain must have ruined these boys' conditions. What the hell do we do now?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: The Tarans came over first thing. I suppose they've moved them to other tents by now.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I said, the Tarans made it in time to move the patients out! They're all safe!
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Including ours?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Yes, including the soldiers, but they weren't in time to shift the pharmaceuticals I brought. I'm afraid those are all soaked now.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: That's fine, I'll think of something.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Thank you, Deaglán, for coming with me to find Acton.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Thank those drugs you've got, not me.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Actually, I ran out of my medicine. The stuff we've been handing out to everyone over the last few days, that was all stuff Acton found with a few others by braving the ruins...
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Tch. Some shite.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Oi, Acton! The hell are you, you bleeding moron? Will you give us a shout already!
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: I'm... I'm over here, I got trapped.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Are you hurt?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: No, it was just, the exit collapsed...
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: What got you inside this cellar, anyway?
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Enough of that, give me a hand. There's an injured woman here who's out cold.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Alright, I'll pull her up.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: It's Máire... She's still alive?
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Hey, you want a scone?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: A scone? Are you having a laugh? Where'd you get the stuff to make that?
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: It was Janie who whipped it up. I don't know what she went into the forest to pick yesterday, but whatever it was, it let her actually make these.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: No joke? Pass me it, I'll try one.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Who knew I'd ever be sitting here having nibbles? We used to not even have a bite to eat.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: That girl led us through cultivating, raising fowls and treating the sick just fine, and she can even knock together a wood house. We're sitting here now and she's even rustled up desserts.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Eat yours, chop-chop! Want another?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: No, I'll save one for Máire.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: How is she?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Looking a lot better, but she still doesn't talk. Too much of a shock to her, losing her child.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Bless Janie, really. She's been sitting by her side the whole time as of late.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Heh, speaking of. Here she comes.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Mr. Acton! I got a reply from my colleagues!
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Janie! That's smashing news.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Phew... They were notifying us just now to say, the branch office south is making an urgent partial transfer of their supplies to us.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: When will they arrive?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: If all goes well, in about a week.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: That's lightning fast!
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Don't get too excited. I think, based on what they said, the convoy's run into a little issue over there? They say they can't get a precise pin on our position. Something must be funny with the signal...
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: That's fine, I'll head up to the plate in a sec to look. Might find some boosters.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Thank you so much. Another thing, we need to stand a flag in the middle of the camp to serve as a marker. That plus the locator will make it convenient for the convoy to accurately orientate once they're approaching.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: A flag? It's not a tricky problem, is it? We can just tear some bright cloth and hoist it up.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: We need a design, at least.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: If you want a design, you may as well grab one of the old county banners from up on the plate.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: What? You're not going to treat yourself as one of County Hillock, are you?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Hmph, could use your barracks boys' ensign as well. Might find one of those on the plate too.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Enough... I never want to see that bloody thing for the rest of my life.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Fine... you come up with something, then.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Janie, do you have any ideas?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I'm not sure myself. We'd have to see what everyone thinks.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Hmph. Here's what everyone thinks: whatever you think, that's best.
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Yeah... I'm in agreement.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Sorry, Acton, for making you do sewing work with me at such a late hour.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: That's fine. As long as you don't find me too clumsy.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Not still worrying over the flag there, are you? You look vexed.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I went all around the camp today asking about the flag, but people all seemed to have the same response ready when I did. They want me to decide.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: It's true. Everyone's always had faith in your decisions.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: It just makes it harder. I need to come up with a proposal that'll satisfy everyone, or else I'll let you all down for trusting in me.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Janie, you know, even if you turned out a blank white flag, none of us would object.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: All this time, you've been busy like mad for us, leading us onto the plate and into the forest to find food while the sun's not even up.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: You barely rest even when you make it back to camp, what with a million sorts of things needing your handling.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I think, fundamentally, everyone's left this flag to you so that you can catch your breath, take your time sewing and properly unwind.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Really...?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Really. If you kept wracking yourself over this flag, well, that would never do.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: ...Thank you.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: I'll leave the rest of it to you, then, Janie. And I think you've earned an early sleep.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: The candlelight's... a little dim. I'll open the window wider, let the moons come in easier.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Oh! Acton, do you hear that singing?
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Eh?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: It might not be too clear with how the wind's picked up. Listen, carefully.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: Oh, I hear it. Where's it coming from?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I don't know...
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: A lone, tender song floats through the breeze, trembling and shaking, but having caught it, they begin, unconsciously, to sing along with it.
And the singing gradually rises, and the wind fades. Until, in every corner of the camp, hovers the song.

attributes.text: ♪ Far in a blink are we from the roses, lilies and stardust all eaten away ♪
♪ And so's though we were a pair of white fowls, sitting atop of the breaks of the waves ♪

attributes.content: It's Máire... I heard her murmuring while I was tending to her.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: It's beautiful.
attributes.name: Saileach

attributes.content: *yawn*... I need my sleep, what's going on out here? Noise and all...
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: Deaglán! Come over here, quick!
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: What happened?!
attributes.name: Twitchy Taran Man

attributes.content: It's Janie! It's Janie!
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Squeezing through the crowd, the man looks to the clearing in the camp.
There, meeting the morning dew and biting winds as she faces a flagpole, stands the figure of a girl tall and straight in respect.
Her dress is in order, not a hair out of place, and she holds in her hands a rolled-up flag.

attributes.text: ♪ If only we were a pair of white feathers, roaming free on the breaks of the waves ♪
♪ Time would farewell us to be forgotten, and never would either we sorrow again ♪
♪ Far in a blink are we from the roses, lilies and stardust all eaten away ♪
♪ And so's though we were a pair of white fowls, sitting atop of the breaks of the waves ♪

attributes.content: Following in the girl's song and her hoisting of the halyard, the flag ascends slowly to the sky, where the wind unfurls it.
A pair of white fowlbeasts soar upon it.
